overview: After completion of this subject, students will have the knowledge and skill to perform and interpret clinical ultrasound of the lung, heart, sternum, estimation of bladder volume, and assessment of the lower limb deep venous system for thrombosis. Students will perform, interpret, write a report and submit a log-book of 15 ultrasound studies and procedures on patients and/or simulators and interpret and report an additional 10 on-line ultrasound studies.
ilo: Comprehensively understand the indications, uses and limitations of focused clinical ultrasound in assessment of the pathology of the lung, heart, deep venous system of the lower limbs, sternum, and volume of the bladder

Perform, interpret and write a structured interpretive report of focused clinical ultrasound for pathology of the lungs, heart, deep venous system of the lower limbs, and bladder volume on patients and/or simulators
Evaluate the requirements for training, competence, and certification of focused ultrasound
generic_skills: Improved procedural skills for students who select a practical subject
Improved written skills and problem-solving skills

Prerequisites.content: Note: these can be taken concurrently (at the same time)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Adequate visual acuity is required to perform and interpret clinical ultrasound. A  student is expected to demonstrate: Sufficient visual acuity to perform the required range of skills, including reading ultrasound monitors across a bed and interpreting ultrasound images on standard commercially available ultrasound machines.

Gross and fine motor skills are required in performing clinical ultrasound. A student is expected to demonstrate adequate gross and fine motor skills to perform focused ultrasound whilst avoiding injury to patients, colleagues and self.

assessment.brief: Multiple-choice questions following each tutorial (25 MCQ)
Interpretation of 10 online case studies assessed by structured MCQ pertaining to each case (50 MCQ)
Complete a logbook of 15 focused ultrasound studies and ultrasound-guided peripheral venous access on either patients or simulators
assessment.hurdle: Student must submit a logbook of 15 focused ultrasound studies and 5 ultrasound-guided peripheral venous access on either patients or simulators to pass this subject.
